str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To raise, lift up. From epi and airo; to raise up.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Middle - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary verb; to look closely at, i.e. perceive; by extension to visit.
From a derivative of echo; a throng; by implication, the rabble; by extension, a class of people; figuratively, a riot.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular

str2: To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.
From philos and hippos; fond of horses; Philippus, the name of four Israelites.
From the base of posis with enclitic adverb of origin; from which or what place, state, source or cause.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To buy. From agora; properly, to go to market, i.e. to purchase; specially, to redeem.
Bread, a loaf, food. From airo; bread or a loaf.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
